title: [K-12] Social Studies Exhibition Learning Effectiveness Enhancement Program Using Digital Learning Sheets: Strengthening Citizenship and Critical Thinking Skills

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of exhibition learning or digital learning tools, foundational knowledge of social studies core concepts (history, geography, politics, economics, culture, citizenship, etc.), preliminary experience analyzing social systems and relationships
context.additional_context: Operated in a smartphone-based learning environment, it progresses through project-based assessments (social issue resolution tasks, local development planning, etc.). It focuses on fostering citizenship and critical thinking, including analysis of diverse social relationships (political, economic, and cultural interactions).

learning_goals: Learners will enhance learning motivation by over 20% using digital learning sheets linked to social studies exhibition content (e.g., historical/geographical materials) and deepen understanding of cultural/institutional contexts.

Learners will analyze application cases of the "sensory exploration principle" in digital learning sheets, apply them to social studies projects (e.g., local culture research, political system comparisons), and contribute to civic competency development.

Learners will develop self-assessment tools for measuring cognitive (conceptual understanding) and psychomotor (field research) learning outcomes in social studies and demonstrate critical thinking in solving social issues.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
